concept.title: Modify execution information of a dynamic test suite
concept.shortdesc: Before executing a dynamic test suite, you might want to modify the execution information, including timeout, retry, and email recipient list for test execution reports.

conbody.p: You can specify additional configurations for test suite execution by expanding the Execution Information section.

section.title: Implicit timeout
section.p: In the Implicit timeout section, you can decide the timeout period. This is how long waits for a page to load. Choose one of the following options:

row.entry: Use the predefined value set in Project > Settings > Execution > Default wait for element timeout (in seconds).
Set a custom waiting time. Input a value in seconds.

section.title: Retry after executing all
section.p: Katalon allows you to rerun test cases in a failed test suite execution to identify flaky tests.
To do so, in the Retry after executing all text field, set the desired number of retry times. By default, this is set to 0.
Choose one of the following options:

ul.li: Retry all executions: Retry all test cases when the test suite fails.

li.p: Retry failed executions only: Retry only failed test cases when the test suite fails.

section.p: For example, when a test suite execution fails, we want to rerun failed test cases in that test suite twice.
In the Retry after executing all checkbox, we input 2 in the text field, then we choose the Retry failed executions only option.
In this case, the test suite is executed three times in total. The first one is the main execution; the latter two are the retried executions when the first execution fails.
Katalon automatically generates reports after each test execution.
